page.title: 01THE SEA AT ROBIN HOODS BAY
page.content: Nearly the entire block is in the sea at Robin Hoods Bay and only a few square metres of land are included in the north west corner. This is 150 ft high cliff with rough grass atop. Below is a fairly extensive rocky intertidal area, sometimes visited by students and tourists. The Cleveland Way footpath passes nearby to the west. Hilly arable and mainly grassland are found inland from the block and 1km away is Robin Hoods Bay village, a popular area for tourists. The land is owned by the National Trust and also being in a National Park (and heritage coast) the area is valued for its scenery and unspoilt nature.
